Why is it those stupid hurricanes are such a big fucking deal but no one pays any mind when a 24" blizzard hits a northern state with 50MPH winds  wiping out electricity for miles upon miles for days on end (do you KNOW how cold that gets?) and causes pile-ups and cars running off the road and spinning out of control and so on and so forth?  My Gramma sent me this:

For those of you who are not aware, North Dakota and southwestern Montana got hit with their first blizzard of the season a couple of weeks ago.

This text is from a County Emergency Manager out in the western part of North Dakota after the storm. Amusing, if it were not so true........

WEATHER BULLETIN: Up here in the Northern Plains we just recovered from an Historic event --- May I even say a "Weather Event" of "Biblical Proportions"? --- With a historic blizzard of up to 24" inches of snow and winds to 50 MPH that broke trees in half, stranded hundreds of motorists in lethal snow banks, closed all roads, isolated scores of communities, and cut power to tens of thousands.

President George Bush did not come.

President George Bush was not expected to come...

President George Bush did not cause the storm...

Global warming did not cause the storm...

FEMA staged nothing...

No one howled for the government to do something...

No one even uttered an expletive on TV...

Nobody demanded $2,000 debit cards...

No one asked for a FEMA Trailer House...

No one looted...

Phil Cantori of the Weather Channel did not come...

And Geraldo Rivera did not move in to be on camera.

Nope, we just melted snow for water, sent out caravans to pluck people out of snow engulfed cars and trucks, checked on our neighbors, fired up wood stoves, broke out coal oil lanterns or Aladdin lamps, and put on an extra layer of clothes because up here it is take care of yourself and others and work or die.

We did not wait for some affirmative action government to get us out of a mess created by being immobilized by a welfare program that trade votes for 'sit at home' checks. Even though a Category "5" blizzard of this scale has never fallen this early, we know it can happen and we know how to deal with it ourselves.

"In my many travels, I have noticed that once one gets north of about 45.25 degrees North Latitude, 90% of the world's social problems evaporate."

I know a few of you on my flist have been forwarded this in e-mail, but I believe it's worth spreading as far as possible, so please, post this in your journals and forward it to whomever you can.  I'm not one for SPAM, but things like this prove that e-mail and blogs can be life-saving mediums:

Recognizing a stroke

 
A neurologist says that if he can get to a stroke victim within 3
hours he can totally reverse the effects of a stroke...totally. He
said the trick was getting a stroke recognized, diagnosed and getting
to the patient within 3
hours which is tough.
 
RECOGNIZING A STROKE - A true story
 
Susie is recouping at an incredible pace for someone with a massive
stroke all because Sherry saw Susie stumble - - that is the key that
isn't mentioned below -and then she asked Susie the 3 questions. So
simple - - this literally saved Susie's life - - Some angel sent it to
Suzie's friend and they did just what it said to do. Suzie failed all
three
so then 9-1-1 was called.
 
Even though she had normal blood pressure readings and did not appear
to be a stroke as she could converse to some extent with the
Paramedics they took her to the hospital right away. Thank God for the
sense to remember the "3" steps. Read and Learn! Sometimes symptoms of
a stroke are difficult to identify.
 
Unfortunately, the lack of awareness spells disaster. The stroke
victim may suffer brain damage when people nearby fail to recognize
the symptoms of a stroke.
 
Now doctors say a bystander can recognize a stroke by asking three
simple
questions:
 
1. *Ask the individual to SMILE.
 
2. *Ask him or her to RAISE BOTH ARMS.
 
3. *Ask the person to SPEAK A SIMPLE SENTENCE (Coherently) (ie . It is
sunny out today)
 
If he or she has trouble with any of these tasks, call 9-1-1
immediately and describe the symptoms to the dispatcher.
 
After discovering that a group of non-medical volunteers could
identify facial weakness, arm weakness and speech problems,
researchers urged the general public to learn the three questions.
They presented their conclusions at the American Stroke Asso! ciation'
s annual meeting last February. Widespread use of this test could
result in prompt diagnosis and treatment of the stroke and prevent
brain damage.
 
A cardiologist says if everyone who gets this e-mail sends it to 10
people, you can bet that at least one life will be saved.
 
 
BE A FRIEND AND SHARE THIS ARTICLE WITH AS MANY FRIENDS AS POSSIBLE,
you could save their lives.

Shipwrecked - A Unique Story for Today  
  
A voyaging ship was wrecked during a storm at sea and only two of the men on it were able to swim to a small, deserted island. The two survivors, not
 knowing what else to do, agreed that they had no other recourse but to pray to
 
 However, to find out whose prayer was more powerful, they agreed to divide the territory between them and stay on opposite sides of the island.
 
 The first thing they prayed for was food.
 
 The next morning, the first man saw a fruit-bearing tree on his side of the land, and he was able to eat its fruit. The other man's parcel of land
 remained barren so he went hungry.

 After a week, the first man was lonely and he decided to pray for a wife.
 
 The next day, another ship was wrecked, and the only survivor was a woman who swam to his side of the land. On the other side of the island, there was
 nothing.
 
 Soon the first man prayed for a house, clothes, and more food. The next day, like magic, all of these were given to him. However, the second man still had
 nothing.
 
 Finally, the first man prayed for a ship, so that he and his wife could leave the island. In the morning, he found a ship docked at his side of the island.
 
 The first man boarded the ship with his wife and decided to leave the second man on the island. He considered the other man unworthy to receive God's
 blessings, since none of his prayers had been answered.
 
 As the ship was about to leave, the first man heard a voice from heaven booming, "Why are you leaving your companion on the island?"

 "My blessings are mine alone, since I was the one who prayed for them," the first man answered. "His prayers were all unanswered and so he does not
 deserve anything."
 
 "You are mistaken!" the voice rebuked him. "He had only one prayer, which I  answered. If not for that, you would not have received any of my blessings."
 
 "Tell me," the first man asked the voice, "What did he pray for that I should owe him anything?"
 
 The voice answered, "He prayed that all your prayers be answered."
 
  
 
 For all we know, our blessings are not the fruits of our prayers alone, but those of another praying for us.
 
 With obedience, come blessings. My prayer for you today is that all your prayers are answered. Be blessed.

Have you ever had an infected pore in the crack of your butt right underneath your tail bone?  Well.  *grins sarcastically*  Sarah has!  My Lord...

Okay, so around January this year I had one, and it hurt horribly.  I couldn't sit against it unless I was against something very soft.  It got pretty swollen and after about a week or two the skin broke and it began to puss and bleed.  I finally saw my doc about it right after it started to drain.  He assumed that it was an infected pore, and since it was draining he gave me a box of Omnicef, an antibiotic that best treats bacterial infections.  He said to come back sooner next time if it happened again. 

Well, between then and now I've had a few minor irritations in that area but nothing like that.  That is until about four days ago.  I felt the irritation and it began to balloon up.  It literally doubled in size over last night alone.  Night before last I hardley slept, for I was tossing and turning all night.  I couldn't sleep on my back, only my sides and I can never lay in one position for more than half an hour unless I'm out cold, so the pain of switching sides kept me awake all night. 

Then yesterday I went to work and it didn't feel very nice, I was wincing all night, but I toughed it out.  When I got home, I showered and cleaned the area very well.  It didn't even hurt to spray the water on it and it was just a little sensative washing it, but it was fine.  No sooner did I lay down did it suddenly seem to flare up.  I wasn't allowed on my right side at all, the pressure was excruciating.  But even on my left side I couldn't find anything comfortable enough to fall asleep on.  So, in tears, I pull myself up (I only have a matress on the floor so its very low), grab a pillow and my blanket and head for the couch.  That was the only place I could get comfortable the day before.  It's a very lumpy couch and it seemed to ease the pressure on the pore, as opossed to my bed which was too normal to lay on.  Was wierd.  Still, I was in too much pain and too uncomfortable.  My body would not allow me to fall asleep. 

About 1:30 Tasha came out of her room (pregnancy insomnia you know.  Not that she doesn't have normal insomnia anyway).  So we were up suffering in pain together for the next four and a half hours.  It was nice to at least have company and get my mind off it a little.  But I felt bad that she couldn't sleep either.  She's been missing a shit load of it.

But, I finally dozed off around 5am and was asleep til 6:30.  I had to pee.  But more importantly, I had to get up because my left side was in so much pain from having the constant pressure on the same areas because I couldn't move around and adjust myself.  So, when I struggled to get up, in tears, moaning and groaning and yelping (alot) between my soreness and that sore on my ass! I had to loosen up a little before I could lay back down, in the same position, and sleep another hour and a half before I had to get up and readjust.  Then when I woke up about 8am, I knew my mom would be up getting ready for work.  She was to be done at 2pm and take me to see the doctor at 3.  Then I'd go into work at 4.  HA!  Not after that night of torture!  I called her, in tears, telling her about it and had her let our managers know I wouldn't be in today! 

So.  I went back to bed and woke up around 10:30.  Then I slept a little over an hour more (after readjusting, in tears) before Tasha came out to take her insulin and eat breakfast.  She layed back down 'round noon and I dozed off til 1:30.  Then I finally got up and slowly made my way, in tears, to get ready for my appointment. 

When mom came to pick me up, I was wondering why I was able to climb into the van so easily (well, easier than I thought I'd be able to anyway, it was still extremely painful).  Then we got to the doc's office and I didn't think I'd be able to sit.  Well, I still had to sit funky, but it again wasn't as painful.  Mom and I went into our room, the nurse took my stats and I was good.  The nurse gave me a robe and had me just take off my jeans.  Well, no sooner did I take off those jeans, did I start yelping in pain again.  I was wearing my thicker jeans (these ones that actually sit above my belly button for some reason) and something about the stiff material was easing the pressure off of the sore. 

Well, the doc checked me out and decided that there wasn't enough puss at the surface yet to slice 'er open and drain 'er (thank GOD!).  So, he gave me a shot of antibiotic as a jump start and then the Omnicef to take for the next ten days.  And between my tension pain and the pain from the sore, he gave me fifteen Vicaden! I had a revelation yesterday morning. Right after the Corey sitch, Craig came home from college.  This being last summer.  We spent most of the summer together, talking, bonding and that's when I started to think that, that closeness was something like those special feelings two people get for one another.  They were closely related but much different.  It was really just that Craig and I were both going through something that we could both relate too, and in that time our friendship blossomed into something that I never thought we'd have when we were in high school.  I'm so happy that our relationship has become what it has.  I'm now confidant that I'm over the misconception of our relationship so that we can keep working on it and continue it's growth.  It's what I've come to learn is something that God want's more than anything.  Strong, deep, meaningful relationships between His people.  Romance is not needed and shouldn't even enter the equation.  It's definitely something I'm proud of because I feel like the relationship I have with Craig and what I'm working on with Tasha is the closest thing to God that I have.  Wow.  Another revelation.  Hallelujah!  God, I thank you for my friends.

I'm getting off topic.  I meant to talk about the guy at work that I'm pining, or not, over.  Well, like I said.  I haven't had this type of crush since high school.  The kind where you feel like your stomaches floating away and you find yourself deep in daydreams and you suddenly smack yourself and think, "I'm not supposed to think that way about him!"

There was a period when I was crushing on him.  See, when you start to get to know Miah you can't help but like him.  He's just a cool guy and oddly he's like SUPER respectful.  Dammit.  This would have been easier for me, had he been an asswhole, right?!?  And then there's his voice.  Dude, I mean serious, Miah has the coolest American accent I've ever heard.  It's like the slightest touch southern with a small twist of ghetto.  Now, I'm not partial to either, but on him, he sounds so... cool.  I mean it's like, light airy versions of southern and ghetto.  It's hard to explain, you just have to trust me. 

Right.  So then shortly after I had decided to crush on Miah, Rebbecca starts working at Hardees.  I've never liked this girl.  She's in a worse mood than I am.  All the time.  (I'm always in a bad mood when I get to work...)  So, suddenly Miah and Becca start going together.  I wasn't heartbroken, because although I sort of crushed on Jeremiah it wasn't anything.... passionate?  It was mostly superficial.  Although, at the same time I wasn't too enthusiastic about the new coupling.  I soon got over it though, and with that went my crush.  I even sort of forgotten that I had a crush on Miah, and all was well with the world. 

Jeremiah and Becca fight like mad, and I believe, unbiasedly, that it's mostly because of Becca.  She's just so insane.  Jealous like nothing I've ever seen.  He can't talk to any girls... no, anyone... without her being the center of attention or she'll just go off (although my mom and I have always seemed to be the exception.  I think mom made is scarily clear to her long ago that if she ever pulled that crap on either of us she was going down.).  Miah works backline (so he cooks) while Becca worked frontline (cashier) but she was in the back more than the food.  Every chance she had (and she made sure she had the chance) she was back there in his biz.  This has always bugged me hardcore and I wondered why he put up with it.  I never said anything to either of them though, as I wasn't really involved and didn't have to work with it.  Becca quit Hardees last week for a job somewhere else, and I have to say I'm surprised that the managers and half the crew didn't throw a party.  Probably out of respect for Miah.  *smirk* 

Nikki, who was the main third shift manager before she went back to school, has been working with Miah more now on second shift.  Nikki is my major inspiration for maturing spiritually and this woman is ALWAYS in the Spirit.  Two Sundays ago she worked with Miah and she popped in this Christian stand-up comedy that she had on CD.  Well, Miah loved it.  The next night he was telling me about it.  That's when it started happening.  My crush suddenly came back.  *smacks self*  Son. Of. A. Bitch.  Could someone PLEASE tell me what's wrong with me.  What is God trying to teach me? 

Anyway.  That night and the next, we had actual conversations.  Miah and I have always chit chatted in passing but never actually held our own conversations and it was like this light flickered on inside.  I want Jeremiah to be saved.  Nikki keeps going on about how he's going to be saved and sanctified and I believe she's going to speak that thing into existence.  Since last week I've been praying hardcore for Miah because I have this sudden, meaningful, I don't know... feeling or knowledge that's in my heart.  I fully believe that Miah is going to be saved and I want it SO much for him.  I suddenly see more to Miah than I've ever seen before.  He's a really special guy and I'm hoping that I can witness this man's testimony.  He's even started wearing his cross to work.  I have no idea why.  I don't know if it's just for Nikki's sake or if he really want's to be saved.  I too, have started encouraging wherever I see the opportunity.  He keeps denying that he'll be saved... but it's only a matter of time.  I just pray that in that time God helps me discern my feelings, so I know what it is I'm really feeling for Miah.  It could just be great Christian love, or it could be something deeper.  But I know that's God's call.  If anything is meant to happen between Miah and I, either God or Miah will instigate that.  Not I.  And that being, that I'm following the very old fashioned Proverb (18:22), that a man who find's a wife has found a good thing.
